title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement ernest@guevarra.io. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing
text: Submit issue issues page

title: Contributing
text: Fork repository Github account Clone version account machine account Make sure track progress upstream .e., version pactr OxfordIHTM/pactr, making changes make sure pull changes upstream either git fetch upstream merge later git pull upstream fetch merge one step Make changes new feature branch Please write test tests changes affect code just documentation Push changes account Submit pull request OxfordIHTM/pactr
code: git clone https://github.com/<yourgithubusername>/pactr.git git remote add upstream https://github.com/OxfordIHTM/pactr.git

what: About the Pandemic PACT Figshare repository
title: Figshare workflow
text: Pandemic PACT data meant publicly available download Figshare per information research programme’s website (see ) based open peer review paper Wellcome Open Research describing study protocol. However, link provided website (https://figshare.com/s/58527668245cb63f14f5) leads privately-shared Figshare collection. means collection accessible created authorised access . contents collection can seen. However, individual items viewed interactively browser downloaded. case 24 August 2024 development package initiated continue current date. contrary mentioned research programme’s website: “data set can downloaded website metadata dataset can downloaded Figshare.” study protocol open peer review: “Finally, database saved csv file made available public Figshare can additionally downloaded online funding tracker.” Thinking maybe just mistake (.e., private public repository link private repository one mistakenly shared), simple search performed within Figshare using keyword “Pandemic PACT” search field. search yielded several results relevant following: https://portal.sds.ox.ac.uk/pandemicpact University Oxford-owned instance Figshare containing various data products (tracker data, data dictionary, scoping review data, extended data) referred used research programme. importantly, collection public hence individual, whether logged Figshare , can view download datasets. Without examining, easy think might publicly available data data products referred website research protocol. However, closer inspection, datasets within collection last updated 2023 names file indicated demonstration datasets. Knowing research programme indeed using Figshare host dataset (accessible) given existence demonstration dataset within University Oxford Figshare instance, development Figshare-specific functions within pactr package utilised demonstration collection prototype Figshare-interface functions hope Pandemic PACT decide share official dataset Figshare publicly, refactoring needed get current functions working minimal. , following guidance use pactr Figshare interface functions used demonstration, development, testing purposes used production research tasks.

title: Figshare workflow
text: package provides application programming interface (API) research programme’s Figshare repository provide programmatic access publicly available tracker data along ’s data products. functions Figshare interface wrappers specific functions {deposits} package provides underlying universal interface various online research data deposition services including Figshare. Current Figshare-specific functionalities available pactr : Listing outputs/assets available Panedmic PACT Figshare repository (experimental); Downloading outputs/assets available Pandemic PACT Figshare repository (experimental); Reading dataset outputs/assets available Pandemic PACT Figshare repository (experimental); , Processing Pandemic PACT data (experimental).

title: Figshare workflow
text: following diagram illustrates current steps (along corresponding functions) designed API interfacing Figshare repository.

title: Figshare workflow
text: Usage pactr always starts setting Figshare client. requires creating Figshare account creating personal access token . Figshare token created, needs stored local environment variable. can done using following command R: token set described , following command can run setup Figshare client: Figshare client setup, can now perform functionalities provided pactr package.

title: Figshare workflow
text: list available outputs/assets Pandemic PACT Figshare repository, issue following command: output data.frame containing metadata regarding contents Figshare Pandemic PACT group. information within metadata provided Figshare’s application programming interface (API) either set Pandemic PACT data team Figshare. data.frame look follows: function useful getting overview currently available Pandemic PACT Figshare repository.
code: pact_list(pact_client) #> # A tibble: 7 × 18 #>   project_id       id title   doi   handle url   published_date #>        <int>    <int> <chr>   <chr> <chr>  <chr> <chr>          #> 1         NA 25827649 Scopin… 10.2… ""     http… 2024-05-15T12… #> 2         NA 25368136 test    10.2… ""     http… 2024-03-08T11… #> 3     189177 25368070 Pandem… 10.2… ""     http… 2024-03-08T10… #> 4     189177 25352839 Extend… 10.2… ""     http… 2024-03-06T15… #> 5     189168 24786258 Pandem… 10.2… ""     http… 2023-12-15T11… #> 6     189168 24773787 Pandem… 10.2… ""     http… 2023-12-11T11… #> 7     189168 24763548 Pandem… 10.2… ""     http… 2023-12-11T11… #> # ℹ 11 more variables: thumb <chr>, defined_type <int>, #> #   defined_type_name <chr>, group_id <int>, #> #   url_private_api <chr>, url_public_api <chr>, #> #   url_private_html <chr>, url_public_html <chr>, #> #   timeline <df[,2]>, resource_title <chr>, #> #   resource_doi <chr>

title: Figshare workflow
text: download specific output/asset - say scoping review data - Pandemic PACT Figshare repository, issue following commands: download file Scoping_Review-Data.xlsx Pandemic PACT Figshare repository current working directory.
code: ## Get the unique identifier for the scoping review data from Figshare ---- file_id <- pact_list(pact_client) |>   subset(title == "Scoping Review Data", select = id) |>   unlist()  pact_download_figshare(pact_client, id = file_id, path = ".")

what: Read the Pandemic PACT tracker dataset and data dictionary
title: Figshare workflow
text: read Pandemic PACT tracker dataset R, issue following command: outputs data.frame available Pandemic PACT funding tracker dataset labelled. function reads labelled tracker dataset default. raw dataset required, issue following command: outputs data.frame available raw Pandemic PACT funding tracker dataset.

what: Process the Pandemic PACT tracker dataset
title: Figshare workflow
Introducing {pactr}
text: pactr provides functions interface programmatically Pandemic PACT’s data products either Figshare repository website. functions Figshare interface wrappers specific functions {deposits} package provides underlying universal interface various online research data deposition services including Figshare. Current Figshare-specific functionalities available pactr : Listing outputs/assets available Panedmic PACT Figshare repository (experimental); Downloading outputs/assets available Pandemic PACT Figshare repository (experimental); Reading dataset outputs/assets available Pandemic PACT Figshare repository (experimental); , Processing Pandemic PACT data (experimental). functions interfacing data available Pandemic PACT website allow downloading, reading, processing. Current website data-specific functionalities available pactr : Downloading Pandemic PACT dataset available website (stable); Reading Pandemic PACT dataset available website (stable); , Processing Pandemic PACT dataset available website (experimental).

title: Introducing {pactr}
text: main motivation development pactr create standardised programmatic interface Pandemic PACT’s data performing research investigation relevant Pandemic PACT’s objectives. Standardised programmatic interface, turn, allows reproducible scientific workflows use Pandemic PACT dataset. Pandemic PACT research programme described “living mapping review” LMR plan six-monthly updates dataset. Robust analytical tools enforces standardised reproducible steps interfacing (reading, processing, analysing) dataset ensures comparability consistency outputs across various types potential research investigations using dataset. tooling also contributes reducing time research ideas research insights discovery. overall vision pactr package development project foster community researchers primarily use R research analysis plan work use Pandemic PACT funding tracker dataset current future research. turn, hope community researchers engage package development following pathways: Use pactr package research work process: identify lacking functionalities; /, report bugs errors come use. Contribute code improve current functionalities /add new functionalities. Contribute documentation use cases application package. Host/initiate training sessions, discussions, /seminars use package relation research related Pandemic PACT funding tracker dataset.

title: Website dataset workflow
text: functions interfacing data available Pandemic PACT website allow downloading, reading, processing. Current website data-specific functionalities available pactr : Downloading Pandemic PACT dataset available website (stable); Reading Pandemic PACT dataset available website (stable); , Processing Pandemic PACT dataset available website (experimental).

title: Website dataset workflow
text: download Pandemic PACT tracker dataset available website, following command can used: return path downloaded dataset:
code: ## Save the dataset from website to a temporary directory ---- pact_download_website(path = tempdir()) #> [1] "/tmp/RtmphrPqml/pandemic-pact-grants.csv"

what: Read the Pandemic PACT tracker dataset from the website
title: Website dataset workflow
text: Instead downloading, Pandemic PACT dataset available website can read R directly follows: results following:

what: Process the Pandemic PACT tracker dataset from the website
title: Website dataset workflow
text: package includes functions process Pandemic PACT tracker dataset specific structures aggregations allow plotting reporting similar outputs currently presented Pandemic PACT website. example, following process Pandemic PACT tracker dataset aggregated dataset structure can used create similar plot one presented website. produces following output:
code: pact_read_website() |>   pact_process_website() |>   pact_process_topic_group(topic = "Disease", group = "GrantStartYear") #> # A tibble: 88 × 3 #>    GrantStartYear Disease                                     n #>             <int> <chr>                                   <int> #>  1           2020 COVID-19                                 4711 #>  2           2020 Congenital Zika virus disease              13 #>  3           2020 Crimean-Congo haemorrhagic fever           30 #>  4           2020 Disease X                                  89 #>  5           2020 Ebola virus disease                       101 #>  6           2020 Hendra virus infection                      1 #>  7           2020 Lassa fever                                19 #>  8           2020 Marburg virus disease                      33 #>  9           2020 Middle East Respiratory Syndrome Coron…    31 #> 10           2020 Mpox                                       11 #> # ℹ 78 more rows

title: Authors and Citation
text: Ernest Guevarra. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation

what: An Interface to the Pandemic PACT Database
title: An Interface to the Pandemic PACT Database
text: Pandemic PACT monitors analyses global funding research evidence related diseases pandemic potential, well broader research preparedness efforts, equipped pivot response outbreaks. collects, curates, codes, analyses data alignment priority diseases selected illnesses, including pandemic influenza, mpox, plague. Pandemic PACT aims guide policy decision-making research funders, policymakers, researchers, multilateral agencies. Pandemic PACT data publicly available download website Figshare. package provides application programming interface (API) research programme’s Figshare repository website data download facility provide programmatic access publicly available tracker data along data products.

title: An Interface to the Pandemic PACT Database
text: pactr provides functions interface programmatically Pandemic PACT’s data products either Figshare repository website. functions Figshare interface wrappers specific functions {deposits} package provides underlying universal interface various online research data deposition services including Figshare. Current Figshare-specific functionalities available pactr : Listing outputs/assets available Panedmic PACT Figshare repository (experimental); Downloading outputs/assets available Pandemic PACT Figshare repository (experimental); Reading dataset outputs/assets available Pandemic PACT Figshare repository (experimental); , Processing Pandemic PACT data (experimental). functions interfacing data available Pandemic PACT website allow downloading, reading, processing. Current website data-specific functionalities available pactr : Downloading Pandemic PACT dataset available website (stable); Reading Pandemic PACT dataset available website (stable); , Processing Pandemic PACT dataset available website (experimental).

title: An Interface to the Pandemic PACT Database
text: main motivation development pactr create standardised programmatic interface Pandemic PACT’s data performing research investigation relevant Pandemic PACT’s objectives. Standardised programmatic interface, turn, allow reproducible scientific workflows based Pandemic PACT dataset.

title: An Interface to the Pandemic PACT Database
text: pactr yet CRAN can installed Oxford IHTM r-universe : Alternatively, pactr can installed directly GitHub using remotes package following command: pactr can loaded use :
code: install.packages(   "pactr",   repos = c("https://oxfordihtm.r-universe.dev", "https://cloud.r-project.org") ) if (!requireNamespace("remotes")) install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("OxfordIHTM/pactr") library(pactr)

title: An Interface to the Pandemic PACT Database
text: Usage pactr always starts setting Figshare client. requires creating Figshare account creating personal access token . Figshare token created, needs stored local environment variable. can done using following command R: token set described , following command can run setup Figshare client: Figshare client setup, can now perform functionalities provided pactr package.

title: An Interface to the Pandemic PACT Database
text: list available outputs/assets Pandemic PACT Figshare repository, issue following command: output data.frame containing metadata regarding contents Figshare Pandemic PACT group. information within metadata provided Figshare’s application programming interface (API) either set Pandemic PACT data team Figshare. data.frame look follows: function useful getting overview currently available Pandemic PACT Figshare repository.

title: An Interface to the Pandemic PACT Database
text: download specific output/asset - say scoping review data - Pandemic PACT Figshare repository, issue following commands: download file Scoping_Review-Data.xlsx Pandemic PACT Figshare repository current working directory.
code: ## Get the unique identifier for the scoping review data from Figshare ---- file_id <- pact_list(pact_client) |>   subset(title == "Scoping Review Data", select = id) |>   unlist()  pact_download_figshare(id = file_id, path = ".")

title: An Interface to the Pandemic PACT Database
text: cite pactr package, please use suggested citation provided call citation() function follows: cite Pandemic PACT Tracker dataset, please use suggested citation provided call pact_cite() function follows:
code: citation("pactr") #> To cite pactr in publications use: #>  #>   Ernest Guevarra (2024). _pactr: An Interface to the Pandemic PACT #>   Repository_. R package version 0.0.9000, #>   <https://oxford-ihtm.io/pactr/>. #>  #> A BibTeX entry for LaTeX users is #>  #>   @Manual{, #>     title = {pactr: An Interface to the Pandemic PACT Repository}, #>     author = {{Ernest Guevarra}}, #>     year = {2024}, #>     note = {R package version 0.0.9000}, #>     url = {https://oxford-ihtm.io/pactr/}, #>   } ## cite the labelled version of the tracker dataset pact_cite(pact_client, id = 24763548)   #> To cite Pandemic PACT Grant Tracker (labelled) in publications use: #>  #>   Pandemic PACT team (2023). "Pandemic PACT Grant Tracker (labelled). #>   dataset version 1." doi:10.25446/oxford.24763548.v1 #>   <https://doi.org/10.25446/oxford.24763548.v1>. #>  #> A BibTeX entry for LaTeX users is #>  #>   @Misc{, #>     title = {Pandemic PACT Grant Tracker (labelled). dataset version 1}, #>     author = {{Pandemic PACT team}}, #>     year = {2023}, #>     doi = {10.25446/oxford.24763548.v1}, #>   }

text: pact_data_list_cols data.frame Pandemic PACT dataset read Pandemic PACT website already pre-processed list columns nested variables. usually obtained via call pact_process_website() col_list = TRUE. topic character value variable name pact_data topic interest. group character value vector two values variable name/s  pact_data_list_cols use grouping variable/s. specified NULL (default), grouping applied tabulation based topic interest group specified. na_values character value vector values strings considered NA topic group. NULL (default), topic group kept .

title: Process variable of interest from Pandemic PACT website data by a grouping variable — pact_table_topic_group
